content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Louisiana Recovery Authority</origin> <pubdate>20070501</pubdate> <title>Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan Community Growth Options: Vacant, Developed, and Constrained Areas; UTM 15N NAD83; LRA (2007); [developable]</title> <edition>First Edition</edition> <geoform>raster digital data</geoform> <onlink>http://lagic.lsu.edu/data/lra/developable.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This GIS raster data set illustrates vacant, developed, and constrained areas for the 35 parishes in the Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan South Louisiana study area. The data set combines environmental or physical constraints (open water, wetland or marsh, and steep slopes) with committed land (parks and civic or institutional land) from various data sources.</abstract> <purpose>The intended use of this data is to provide a physical planning framework in which to allocate new growth as part of the Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan Community Growth and Transportation Options.</purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>unknown</begdate> <enddate>2006</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-95.042649</westbc> <eastbc>-87.901932</eastbc> <northbc>33.534684</northbc> <southbc>28.776548</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>Louisiana Speaks</themekey> <themekey>Regional Plan</themekey> <themekey>Community Growth Options</themekey> <themekey>vacant</themekey> <themekey>developed</themekey> <themekey>constrained</themekey> <themekey>land use</themekey> <themekey>committed</themekey> <themekey>civic</themekey> <themekey>institutional</themekey> <themekey>steep slopes</themekey> <themekey>wetland</themekey> <themekey>marsh</themekey> <themekey>open water</themekey> <themekey>parks</themekey> <themekey>open space</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekey>Louisiana</placekey> <placekey>Louisiana Coast</placekey> <placekey>South Louisiana</placekey> <placekey>Gulf Coast</placekey> </place> <temporal> <tempkey>Pre-Katrina</tempkey> <tempkey>Pre-Rita</tempkey> <tempkey>2005</tempkey> </temporal> </keywords> <accconst>None.</accconst> <useconst> Acknowledgement of the Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan and Louisiana Recovery Authority would be appreciated in products developed from these data. Nevertheless, the user should be aware that the information on which it is based may have come from a variety of sources of varying degrees of accuracy. Therefore, Calthorpe Associates cannot guarantee the accuracy of this data set, and does not accept any responsibility for the consequences of its use. <procstep> <procdesc> TIGER/Line Hydrographic Polygons and Lines for Louisiana and Land Cover Classification for Louisiana GAP Analysis Project were projected into NAD 83, UTM Zone 15N then clipped to the 35-parish Louisiana Speaks Regional Plan study area using ArcToolbox and ArcView 3.2.  Hydrographic Polygons and Lines, Land Cover Classifications, Steep Slopes, and Land Use Data combined using ArcView 3.2.  Grid reclassified as follows: 0 - Constrained (Open Water; Wetland or Marsh; Committed Land Uses [Civic or Institutional; Parks and Open Space]) 1 - Vacant (Vacant; Barren; Upland Forest or Scrub Vegetation; Agriculture, Grassland or Cropland) 2 - Developed (Urban [Unclassified]; Commercial, Single Family Residential; Multifamily Residential; Industrial) </procdesc> <srcused>Vacant/Constrained Grid</srcused> <procdate>07012006</procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Eric Yurkovich</cntper> <cntorg>Calthorpe Associates</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Project Coordinator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>2095 Rose Street, Suite 201</address> <city>Berkeley</city> <state>California</state> <postal>94709</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(510) 548-6800</cntvoice> <cntfax>(510) 548-6848</cntfax> <cntemail>eric@calthorpe.com</cntemail> <hours>9 AM to 6 PM for phone calls.
